title: How to Drink Baileys: Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Cocktails & More

steps.title: Brew
steps.content: Brew your coffee. Use automatic drip, a French press, the pour-over method, or even instant coffee—the stronger your beverage is, the better.

steps.title: Make a whipped topping for your coffee.
steps.content: Make a whipped topping for your coffee. Pour 1 c (240 mL) of heavy cream and 3 US tbsp (44 mL) of Baileys into a metal bowl. Use an electric mixer to beat the ingredients together until stiff peaks form. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mix Baileys, sugar, and coffee together for your base drink.
steps.content: Mix Baileys, sugar, and coffee together for your base drink. Grab a tall glass and pour in 2 to 3 US tbsp (30 to 44 mL) of Baileys, 1 tbsp (12.5 g) of brown sugar, and 1 c (240 mL) of coffee. Stir all the ingredients together, leaving ample space on the top for your spiked whipped cream. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Finish your drink with whipped cream.
steps.content: Finish your drink with whipped cream. Top your drink with a liberal amount of the Baileys whipped cream you prepared earlier. [3] X Research source Alternative: Don’t feel like making special whipped cream? Just make a simple spiked coffee by combining 4 fl oz (120 mL) of hot coffee with 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys. [4] X Research source

steps.title: B-52 Shot
steps.content: B-52 Shot Pour 1 ⁄ 3 fl oz (9.9 mL) of Grand Marnier into a shot glass, followed by 1 ⁄ 3 fl oz (9.9 mL) of Baileys and 1 ⁄ 3 fl oz (9.9 mL) of Kahlua . Enjoy your triple-decker combination of coffee, cream, and citrus flavors! [5] X Research source The B-52 is a layered shot that starts with the densest liquid on the bottom of the shot glass.

steps.title: Blow Job Shot
steps.content: Blow Job Shot Start by pouring 1 ⁄ 2 fl oz (15 mL) of amaretto into a shot glass, followed by 1 ⁄ 4 fl oz (7.4 mL) of Baileys. Then, top your drink with a liberal amount of whipped cream. [6] X Research source The Blow Job contains Baileys Irish Cream as well as whipped cream, so it's a dairy lover's drink. Try to layer this shooter rather than mix or blend it. To really get into the spirit of the BJ shot, keep your hands behind your back when you take this shot, and try drinking the shot using your mouth alone. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Screaming Orgasm Shot
steps.content: Screaming Orgasm Shot Pour an equal amount ( 1 ⁄ 4 fluid ounce (7.4 mL) each) of Baileys, vodka , amaretto, and Kahlua into an ice-filled cocktail shaker. After shaking it all together, strain the mixture into a shot glass. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Jello Shot
steps.content: Baileys Jello Shot Dissolve 2 packets of unflavored gelatin in 1 c (240 mL) of coffee. Once everything is dissolved, stir in 2 ⁄ 3 c (160 mL) of Baileys along with 1 ⁄ 3 c (79 mL) of whiskey. Pour the mixture evenly into 12 plastic shot glasses , and stick it in the fridge for 2-3 hours. When the shots are set, serve them with a dollop of whipped cream and some chocolate shavings. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tiramisu Shots
steps.content: Tiramisu Shots Pour 2 ⁄ 3 fl oz (20 mL) of Kahlua each into 3 shot glasses. Then, mix 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys and 2 fl oz (59 mL) of heavy cream and cocktail shaker before layering it on top of the Kahlua in each shot glass. As a finishing touch, garnish each shot with whipped cream and a dusting of cocoa powder. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Hot Cocoa Pudding Shots
steps.content: Hot Cocoa Pudding Shots Stir one 3.9 oz (110 g) packet of chocolate pudding mix with one 0.73 oz (21 g) packet of hot cocoa mix, along with 2 ⁄ 3 c (160 mL) of whole milk. Once the entire mixture is combined, stir in 2 ⁄ 3 c (160 mL) of Baileys and 1 ⁄ 2 tsp (2.5 mL) of vanilla extract. Divide the pudding into 12 plastic shot glasses, and refrigerate them for 2 hours until they’re set. [11] X Research source Give your shots an extra punch of hot cocoa by topping them with whipped cream, cocoa powder, and mini marshmallows.

steps.title: Classic Baileys Martini
steps.content: Classic Baileys Martini Mix 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys with 1 ⁄ 4 fl oz (7.4 mL) of vodka. Shake the mixture together in an ice-filled cocktail shaker , before straining it into a chilled martini glass . [12] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Flat White Martini
steps.content: Baileys Flat White Martini Pour 1.6 oz (50 mL) of Baileys, 0.8 oz (25 mL) of espresso, and 0.8 oz (25 mL) of vodka into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake your drink until it's good and cold, and then strain it into a martini glass. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Chocolatini
steps.content: Baileys Chocolatini Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, and then pour in 3 1 ⁄ 2 US tbsp (52 mL) of Baileys, 2 1 ⁄ 2 tsp (12 mL) of vodka, and 1 1 ⁄ 2 US tbsp (22 mL) of chocolate liqueur. Shake your drink, and then strain it into a martini glass. [14] X Research source For a flourish, you can garnish your glass with shaved chocolate or a dusting of cocoa powder.

steps.title: Frozen Mudslide
steps.content: Frozen Mudslide Make a frozen mudslide by blending 4 cups (600 g) of crushed ice along with 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of chocolate syrup, 1 1 ⁄ 2 fl oz (44 mL) of vodka, 1 1 ⁄ 2 fl oz (44 mL) of coffee-flavored liqueur, and 1 1 ⁄ 2 fl oz (44 mL) of Baileys. Pour the mixture into 4 separate glasses, topping each one with whipped cream. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Mint Martini
steps.content: Baileys Mint Martini Mix 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys and 1 fl oz (30 mL) of peppermint liqueur together in an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Then, filter the mixture into a martini glass and garnish it with dark chocolate shavings. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare the hot chocolate
steps.content: Prepare the hot chocolate as your base drink. With your stove set to medium-low heat, mix 2 tbsp (15 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1-2 tbsp (13-26 g) of sugar, 1 pinch of salt, and 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of milk together in a saucepan. Once the sugar and cocoa powder completely dissolve, pour in 7 ⁄ 8 c (210 mL) of milk. Turn the heat up to medium, stirring the mixture once in awhile. To finish things off, stir in 1 ⁄ 4 tsp (1.2 mL) of vanilla extract. [17] X Research source Instant hot chocolate can work, as can hot chocolates flavored with mint or caramel. You will add Baileys at the end of the process, so you can make hot chocolate according to your own recipe.

steps.title: Stir 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys into your hot chocolate.
steps.content: Stir 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys into your hot chocolate. As a general rule of thumb, add 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys per 1 c (240 mL) of hot chocolate. [18] X Research source Start with less, then taste to gauge the flavor before you add more.

steps.title: Garnish your hot chocolate with all of your favorite sweet toppings.
steps.content: Garnish your hot chocolate with all of your favorite sweet toppings. Top your hot chocolate with whipped cream, along with miniature marshmallows and chocolate shavings. For even more flourish, try: Adding a drizzle of chocolate sauce [19] X Research source Sticking a chocolate wafer cookie into the whipped cream. Serving the milkshake with a cookie straw.

steps.title: Add 2 scoops of ice cream and some Baileys to a blender.
steps.content: Add 2 scoops of ice cream and some Baileys to a blender. Add 1 scoop of vanilla and 1 scoop of chocolate ice cream to your mixer, along with 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys. [20] X Research source Feel free to get creative with your ice cream flavors, though—Baileys and coffee ice cream go well together, as well as mint chocolate chip, peanut butter, rum raisin, pumpkin, or cookies and cream.

steps.title: Add caramel sauce and chocolate sauce to the mixture.
steps.content: Add caramel sauce and chocolate sauce to the mixture. Squeeze in 1 US tbsp (15 mL) chocolate sauce to your alcoholic ice cream mixture, along with 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of caramel sauce. [21] X Research source Feel free to add other flavors that go well with Baileys, like citrus or Amaretto, as well as: Fresh fruit like a banana, peaches, or strawberries. Peanuts, walnuts, or almonds.

steps.title: Blend the ice cream, Baileys, and mix-ins with milk to your desired consistency.
steps.content: Blend the ice cream, Baileys, and mix-ins with milk to your desired consistency. In addition to your ice cream, Baileys, sauces, and mix-ins, pour in 2 c (470 mL) of whole milk. Blend everything together in your blender or milkshake maker. [22] X Research source For a thicker milkshake, use a little less milk. For a thinner milkshake, use a little more.

steps.title: Top your drink with whipped cream.
steps.content: Top your drink with whipped cream. Whipped cream from a can is totally fine for this. [23] X Research source However, you can get ambitious and make your own Baileys whipped cream by whipping 1 c (240 mL) of heavy cream and 3 US tbsp (44 mL) of Baileys into a metal bowl and beating with an electric mixer until it's stiff. [24] X Research source Feel free to top your milkshake with all sorts of toppings, like sprinkles, mini marshmallows, and pieces of crumbled cookies. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Straight Baileys
steps.content: Straight Baileys Add a handful of ice to a drinking glass, followed by 3 1 ⁄ 2 fl oz (100 mL) of Baileys. Enjoy your sweet but brisk drink!

steps.title: Baileys Jack Knife
steps.content: Baileys Jack Knife Make this strong drink by mixing 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys with 2 fl oz (59 mL) of whiskey . Shake your concoction until it's cold, and then strain it into a lowball glass . [26] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Irish Floats
steps.content: Baileys Irish Floats Add 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream into a tall glass, along with 1 c (240 mL) of Guiness and 1 ⁄ 4 c (59 mL) of Baileys. Garnish your drink with a little bit of chocolate syrup, and it’s good to go. [27] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Irish Slammers
steps.content: Baileys Irish Slammers Pour a standard of bottle of Guiness into a tall glass first. Then, pour 1 fl oz (30 mL) of Baileys and 1 fl oz (30 mL) of Irish whiskey into 2 separate shot glasses. Drop both of these glasses into the Guiness glass and drink the beverage right away. [28] X Research source

steps.title: Baileys Frozen Hot Chocolate
steps.content: Baileys Frozen Hot Chocolate Scoop ice into your blender until it’s completely full. Then, drizzle in 4 c (950 mL) of chocolate milk, 4 packets (1 oz) of hot chocolate mix, and 4 fl oz (120 mL) of Baileys. Blend everything until it’s thoroughly mixed together, and pour the beverage into 4 glasses. [29] X Research source For a fun finish, squeeze a little of bit of chocolate syrup into each glass before you pour the hot chocolate it. Feel free to garnish each glass with a squirt of whipped cream and some chocolate pieces, too.

steps.title: Baileys White Russian
steps.content: Baileys White Russian Scoop a few ice cubes into a lowball glass. In an ice-filled cocktail shaker, mix 1.6 oz (50 mL) of vodka and 0.8 oz (25 mL) of Baileys together before pouring it into the lowball glass. Fill the glass up the rest of the way with 1.6 oz (50 mL) of cream, and add a few chocolate shavings on top for good measure. [30] X Research source For a more authentic White Russian flavor, use coffee-flavored Baileys .

steps.title: Baileys Beach Baby
steps.content: Baileys Beach Baby Mix 2 fl oz (59 mL) of Baileys, 1 fl oz (30 mL) of coconut rum , and 1 fl oz (30 mL) of cream mixed with a splash of half-and-half in an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Then, pour the drink into any kind of drinking glass. [31] X Research source
